column4: hey, i just installed network-manager-gnome (to get my WPA wifi working) but the little icon just says "No network connection" .. context menu doesn't have anything about adding a connection
u can check wether is up or not
iwconfig ? how can i check if it's up
if is up, it contains an ip
that doesn't help me set it up tho
ur wireless is eth0 or eth1?
it's clearly not going to work if i don't configure the encryption
ya, ur gnome network gui not working?
the gui should have list down eth0 eth1
sorry, my ubuntu is not with me now... it should be something call gnome-network something
search around other network manager, maybe u use the wrong manager, i am not sure.
in case u run it term, remember to put gksudo infront
